meanings.sent1: The rabblements outside the stadium were causing a commotion.
meanings.sent2: The city square was filled with rabblements during the protest.
meanings.sent3: The rabblements at the concert were so loud, they drowned out the music.
meanings.sent4: The classroom turned into a sea of rabblements as the students got rowdy.
meanings.sent5: The rabblements in the market made it hard to hear the vendors.

meanings.definition: A collection of worthless or inferior items or people
meanings.sent1: The attic was full of old rabblements that no one wanted.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a table of rabblements that nobody bought.
meanings.sent3: The yard sale was a treasure trove for those who loved rabblements.
meanings.sent4: Her room was cluttered with rabblements she couldn't bear to part with.
meanings.sent5: The thrift store had a section dedicated to selling rabblements.
